prompt: <description>Part 1: A long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Step 1: Create a 2D sketch Create a new coordinate system based on the provided `Euler Angles` and `Translation Vector`. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch should have one face (face\\_1) consisting of 4 lines. - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0446] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0446], End Point [0.0, 0.0446] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0446], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter `sketch_scale`: `sketch_scale = 0.75` Step 3: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the `coordinate_system`. The rotation angles are: - X-axis rotation: 0.0° - Y-axis rotation: 0.0° - Z-axis rotation: -90.0° The translation vector is: - X: 0.0 - Y: 0.0223 - Z: 0.0 Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector creating a 0.0112 depth extrusion on both sides. The `sketch_scale` of the extrusion is equal to the sketch's scaling parameter: `sketch_scale = 0.75` Step 5 (Final shape description) The final shape of this part is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of the part are: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0223 - Height: 0.1836 (0.0918 depth on both sides)</description>

The object has a flat top and bottom. The hole is elongated and narrows towards the center. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. It has a height of 0.148 x width of 0.75 x length of 0.75.</description>
